Article.ArticleTitle: Core-Shell-Like Structured Co<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub>@SiO<sub>2</sub> Catalyst for Highly Efficient Catalytic Elimination of Ozone.

AbstractText: Co<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub> is an environmental catalyst that can effectively decompose ozone, but is strongly affected by water vapor. In this study, Co<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub>@SiO<sub>2</sub> catalysts with a core-shell-like structure were synthesized following the hydrothermal method. At 60% relative humidity and a space velocity of 720,000 h<sup>-1</sup>, the prepared Co<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub>@SiO<sub>2</sub> obtained 95% ozone decomposition for 40 ppm ozone after 6 h, which far outperformed that of the 25wt% Co<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub>/SiO<sub>2</sub> catalysts. The superiority of Co<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub>@SiO<sub>2</sub> is ascribed to its core@shell structure, in which Co<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub> is wrapped inside the SiO<sub>2</sub> shell structure to avoid air exposure. This research provides important guidance for the high humidity resistance of catalysts for ozone decomposition.
